flow.descriptionCdata:
d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.13102878-7909-4aa6-94c2-6be50fe499a9.description=Run communication test on the given SA server or device group. This operation is supported from SA version 9.1 (sas91). Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. attachableName - The names of either the servers, or the device groups, separated by 'separator'. attachableID - The ids of either the servers, or the device groups, separated by 'separator'. If provided, the 'attachableName' will be ignored. attachableType - The type of the attachable items. Can be one of the following values\: SERVER or DEVICE_GROUP. timeout - Timeout in milliseconds, to wait for the job to finish. Default value is 0. separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is comma (,). Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: returnResult - The id of the job created. d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.1ec31a69-c0e6-4c76-b7bb-b168aeb0b863.prompt=Enter a value for coreHost d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.31be7604-d842-422a-941d-d44799e87ad6.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.346fff37-0e1c-4c37-9e8b-76ed14136c4c.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.3b524add-dd2d-443c-a78e-c2574b36cb82.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.6b063044-42df-463b-9af0-d8ac922c7134.callout=Forcing the registration for Demo d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.7fff6f5f-e934-4623-a88a-4aaf6f98c469.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.818e2df0-5299-4e24-86eb-e961b70a9a9c.description=
Tries to make a connection to the request port.

Input Parameters\:
    host - hostname or IP address of the target host.
    port - port to connect to.
    portType - the type of port (TCP or UDP).
    timeout - The timeout in seconds for tcp connection and for udp response.

Responses\:
    port opened - a successful connection was made.
    port closed - unable to make a connection.
    host not found - could not resolve hostname to a valid IP address.

Extra Results\:
    addresses - list of addresses returned from DNS.
    aliases - list of aliases returned from DNS.
    addresspinged - actual IP address pinged.
d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.92f09ebb-f776-4f10-95df-65c8b85e6e5b.description=Assigns a patch policy to each server, device group or hypervisor contained in the list of attachable items. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. patchPolicyName - The name of the patch policy. patchPolicyID - The ID of the patch policy. If this input is provided, then patchPolicyName is ignored. attachableNames - A comma separated list of server, device group or hypervisor names to which the patch policy will be attached. The elements of the list must be all of the same type. (e.g. names of servers) attachableIDs - A comma separated list of server, device group or hypervisor ids to which the patch policy will be attached. The elements of the list must be all of the same type. (e.g. ids of servers) attachableType - The type of the attachable items. Can be one of the following values\: SERVER, DEVICE_GROUP, HYPERVISOR. Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.9a3f09d6-a867-46ca-89ba-c9f40241314e.description=Starts a remediation on the given server using a set of attached/detached software policies. If the software policies information is not provided, then a full software policy remediation is performed. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The names of the servers to remediate (separated by 'separator'). serverId - The IDs of the servers to remediate (separated by 'separator'). If provided, the 'serverName' is ignored. softwarePoliciesNames - The names of the software policies to remediate against (separated by 'separator'). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. softwarePoliciesIDs - The IDs of the software policies to remediate against (separated by 'separator'). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. If this input is provided, then 'softwarePoliciesNames' is ignored. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. sortPolicies - Specify whether the software policies should be remediated in alphabetical order, based on their names, on each server. The default value is 'false'. ticketID - The ticket ID for this job. If not specified it will be set default value\: 'Remediation started by SA user from OO server 'host_address' separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is a comma (,). notificationFailureOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job failed. notificationSuccessOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job succeeded. notificationCancelOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job was canceled. notificationFailureRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job failed. notificationSuccessRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job succeeded. notificationCancelRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job was canceled. scheduleDateYear - The year to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateMonth - The month to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 12. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateDayOfMonth - The day to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 31. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateHour - The hour to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 23. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateMinute - The minute to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateSecond - The second to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateTimezone - The timezone used to express the job schedule date. If not set, it will have the default value GMT. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the created job. d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.ab7a0682-d386-40ec-b936-2844481b81f4.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.ace6204b-b037-4b7f-ab6e-46a0052f23ab.description=Get patch policy information. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. patchPolicyName - The name or the search expression for the patch policy. Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: id - The unique ID of this object. createdBy - The name of the user who created this object. createdDate - The date that this object was created. dirtyAttributes - A ; delimited list of attributes that are dirty (Modified and not yet fully propagated). modifiedBy - The user who last modified this object. modifiedDate - The date that this object was last modified on. name - The name of this object description - The description of this object. patchPolicyType - Type of patch policy platformID - The id of the platform. platformName - The name of the platform. customerName - The name of the customer this object was created for. customerID - The ID of the customer this object was created for. patchPolicyAssociatedServerNames - Server names associated with the patch policy patchPolicyAssociatedServerIDs - Server IDs associated with the patch policy patchPolicyAssociatedDeviceGroupNames - Device group names associated with the patch policy patchPolicyAssociatedDeviceGroupIDs - Device group IDs associated with the patch policy d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.b1e2a91d-7b18-417b-9f8a-de86152abaee.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.b3a51403-0031-42c7-892d-32617ba23b9f.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.c706aadf-0047-44ea-8231-4a161950b1c2.description=Attaches a software policy to a list of servers/device groups/hypervisors. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. policyName - The name of the policy to attach. policyID - The ID of the policy to attach. If this input is provided, then 'policyName' is ignored. attachableName - The names, separated by 'separator', of the attachable objects to attach the policy to. attachableID - The IDs, separated by 'separator', of the attachable objects to attach the policy to. If this input is provided, then 'attachableName' is ignored. attachableType - The type of the attachable objects (all must be of the same type). Can be\: SERVER, DEVICE_GROUP, HYPERVISOR. separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is comma (,). Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.d97b4255-8a50-4844-837f-758d8770c8ce.description=This operation could be used to remediate the given server against a given set of directly attached patch policies. If the patch policies information is not provided, then a full patch policy remediation is performed. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - List of names for servers to remediate(separated by 'separator'). If multiple servers are specified then they must be of the same platform type. serverID - List of ids for servers to remediate(separated by 'separator'). If this input is provided then 'serverName' is ignored. If multiple servers are specified then they must be of the same platform type. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. patchPoliciesNames - Name of the patch policies (separated by 'separator'). patchPoliciesIDs - Object ids of the patch policies (separated by 'separator'). rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. sortPolicies - Specify whether the software policies should be remediated in alphabetical order, based on their names, on each server. The default value is 'false'. ticketID - The ticket ID for this job. If not specified it will be set default value\: 'Remediation started by SA user from OO server 'host_address' separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is a comma (,). notificationFailureOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job failed. notificationSuccessOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job succeeded. notificationCancelOwner - The email address of the owner of the job when the job was canceled. notificationFailureRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job failed. notificationSuccessRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job succeeded. notificationCancelRecipients - The email addresses to notify when the job was canceled. scheduleDateYear - The year to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateMonth - The month to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 12. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateDayOfMonth - The day to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 1 and 31. This input must be provided for setting a job schedule. scheduleDateHour - The hour to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 23. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateMinute - The minute to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateSecond - The second to be used for setting the date when the job is scheduled to start. It should have the value between 0 and 59. If not set, if will have the default value 0. scheduleDateTimezone - The timezone used to express the job schedule date. If not set, it will have the default value GMT. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the job created. d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.ef9f74c3-014e-4026-aeb8-89b77ab9427d.prompt=HostName\: d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.f6820fe2-7bc2-4ebc-866e-65c9c07db047.prompt=Enter a value for coreHost d65153d8-0182-48e8-b0b6-9d4c25b15209.f9d66c50-9643-46f4-b9ed-4fc4e02750ae.description=Checks to see if a job is completed or not Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. jobID - the id of the job Responses\: running - job is still running completed - job has completed or is terminated in error failure - failed to retrieve data
flow.name: applyPatches

step.name: Check For SA Agent On Port 1002

staticBinding.value: June 2016 - Windows Server 2012 R2 x64 Approved Patch Policy
